record.title: ORDERS FOR MONDAY, OCTOBER 1, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR MONDAY, OCTOBER 1, 2007 -- (Senate - September 28, 2007)

[Page: S12340]

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 2 p.m., Monday, October 1; that on Monday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders reserved for their use later in the day, and there then be a period of morning business until 3 p.m., with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each, and the time equally divided and controlled between the two sides; that at 3 p.m., the Senate resume consideration of H.R. 1585.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
